column4: I'd expect doubling the ram to make a noticable difference, if you can find ram that fits
yeah, 2 512 or 1GB sticks would boost it significantly.  It's the USB1.1 that kills me, lol.
that's fixable, I think (there are pci cards out there that add usb ports)
This is true.  I might pick one of those up too ... they're rather cheap, I believe.
I'd expect them to be, but haven't needed one
Expectantly :P I don't think there's a single person in here running lower-specced hardware than me
Though I wouldn't expect to be surprised
my primary system isn't *that* fast by modern standards either, although faster than yours
(athlon xp 2600+, 1280MiB of ram, radeon 9600xt for video)
Not bad, good for everyday use ... just like this one, but this one chokes if you give it too much to do
upgrading the ram from 512MiB to 1280MiB really helped multitasking-wise. Running a browser with a bunch of tabs tends to eat up 200MiB or so, so there's not that much room left with 512 total.
other specs don't matter as much as long as you're a bit patient and know how to use "nice" on long-running tasks
Really, I think I'm just going to invest a bit of money into a new mobo and a 512 stick of DDR (I already have one kicking around, so I'd be up to a gig)
I hate the fact that I'm on SDRAM and Usb1.1 ... I feel like an old man :P
yeah, upgrades get a bit hard to come by (had some fun finding a new cpu heatsink+fan for an old system recently)
That's always a trip, eh? Reminds me of a buddy of mine who builds computers, a big lug with a temper ... I can't remember how many mobo's hes destroyed trying to remove intel P4 heatsinks
